docs.title: Home
docs.text:
HitboxRemaster is a stand-alone ModuleScript that provides easy and performant dynamic Hitboxes and static Zones.

Why HitboxRemaster?

  • Easy to use - Clear and concise class API, ready for simple operations in just a few lines.
  • Type-safe - Extensively typed. Safe to use in a strict-typechecking environment.
  • Powerful - Libraries like Trajectory and Metafunctions to enable advanced use-cases.
  • Customizable - Customize the behavior of individual Hitboxes and Zones with properties and methods.
  • Performant - Blazingly-fast to run and use. (Details in (root)/Benchmark)
  • Object-oriented - Everything in this module are objects, enabling compatibility with different programming paradigms.
  • Memory-proof - Automatic garbage-collect operations. Manual garbage-collect can be initiated on every class with simple methods.
  • Replication - Fully usable on both server and client. (WARNING: The Hitbox and Zone serials may overlap across server and client. You need to handle such scenarios yourself)

If anything is missing or broken, file an issue on github or message me on discord (lady_celestia).

Disclaimer: HitboxRemaster is not thoroughly tested in a production environment yet. Production-stability is not guaranteed, although any issue found will be fixed.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
Both Studio and VSCode:

Copy the code of HitboxRemaster into a ModuleScript, then require the ModuleScript on the Script or LocalScript you want to use it in.

roblox-ts: gg

Read the Examples page for a quickstart guide. Alternatively, you can read the API page for a more in-depth guide.

You are free to use and modify HitboxRemaster, for personal or commercial use, with or without credit (though some credit would be nice <3). However, you cannot claim that you made HitboxRemaster.

docs.title: Hitbox
docs.text: The main Hitbox class returned by Module.newHitbox(Fields).

docs.title: Module.newHitbox(Fields: {string: any})
docs.text:
local hitbox = Module.newHitbox({
    Attachment = attachment or nil,
    Shape = ("Box" or "Sphere") or "Box",
    Position = Vector3 or Vector3.new(0, 0, 0),
    Debounce = number or 5,
    Pierce = number or 1,
    LifeTime = number or 1,
    Orientation = Vector3 or nil,
    CopyCFrame = BasePart or nil,
    CopyCFrameProperties = {CFrame = boolean?, Position = boolean?, Size = boolean?, Orientation = boolean?} or {CFrame = true, Size = true}
    Radius = number or 3,
    Size = Vector3 or Vector3.new(3, 3, 3),
    FilterType = Enum.RaycastFilterType or Enum.RaycastFilterType.Exclude,
    FilterDescendantsInstances = {Instance} or {},
    RespectCanCollide = boolean or false,
    MaxParts = number or 0
}) -> Hitbox
Create a new Hitbox object. Fields are optional.

docs.title: Hitbox.ShapeEnum
docs.text:
Hitbox.ShapeEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.Shape. Includes ShapeEnum.Box and ShapeEnum.Sphere.

docs.title: Hitbox.ModeEnum
docs.text:
Hitbox.ModeEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.HitboxMode. Includes ModeEnum.None, ModeEnum.Attachment, ModeEnum.Linear, ModeEnum.Bezier, ModeEnum.Orientation and ModeEnum.Copying

docs.title: Hitbox.StateEnum
docs.text:
Hitbox.StateEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.StateEnum. Includes StateEnum.Paused, StateEnum.Active and StateEnum.Dead.

docs.title: Hitbox.ConstructionEnum
docs.text:
Hitbox.ConstructionEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.ConstructionMode. Includes ConstructionEnum.None, ConstructionEnum.Linear and ConstructionEnum.Bezier.

docs.title: Hitbox.BezierEnum
docs.text:
Hitbox.BezierEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.BezierMode. Includes BezierEnum.Quadratic and BezierEnum.Cubic.

docs.title: Hitbox.Serial
docs.text:
Hitbox.Serial -- number
A readonly number that is the Hitbox's unique serial. WARNING: Do NOT change under any circumstance.

docs.title: Hitbox.Shape
docs.text:
Hitbox.Shape -- string
The current shape of the Hitbox. Can be Box or Sphere.

docs.title: Hitbox.Position
docs.text:
Hitbox.Position -- Vector3
The current center position of the Hitbox. Note: Any changes will be prevented if the Hitbox is currently using a bezier path.

docs.title: Hitbox.Pierce
docs.text:
Hitbox.Pierce -- number
How many Humanoids can the Hitbox hit in total.

docs.title: Hitbox.Debounce
docs.text:
Hitbox.Debounce -- number
How many seconds have to pass before the Hitbox can hit the same Humanoid again.

docs.title: Hitbox.LifeTime
docs.text:
Hitbox.LifeTime -- number
How many seconds the Hitbox has left before it automatically cleans and garbage collects itself. Only counts down while the Hitbox is activated. Note: This property does not countdown if the Hitbox is currently using a bezier path. The Hitbox will clean itself when it reaches the end of the bezier path instead.

docs.title: Hitbox.Orientation
docs.text:
Hitbox.Orientation -- Vector3
The orientation of the Hitbox. Note: CopyCFrame overrides this property.

docs.title: Hitbox.CopyCFrame
docs.text:
Hitbox.CopyCFrame -- BasePart
A part which the Hitbox will copy Position, Size and Orientation from. WARNING: Overrides all constructed paths if not nil. Overrides Orientation, Position and Size by default (See Hitbox.CopyCFrameProperties). Does NOT override Hitbox.Shape

docs.title: Hitbox.CopyCFrameProperties
docs.text:
Hitbox.CopyCFrameProperties -- {CFrame = boolean, Size = boolean, Position = boolean, Orientation = boolean}
A table which determines what properties are copied over from Hitbox.CopyCFrame. Properties with nil or false are ignored and not changed by CopyCFrame. Default {CFrame = true, Size = true} Note: If CFrame is true, Position and Size can be left as nil or false and those properties will be copied over regardless. Same for the other way around.

docs.title: Hitbox.OverlapParams
docs.text:
Hitbox.OverlapParams -- OverlapParams
The OverlapParams that's used for spatial query.

docs.title: Hitbox.Active
docs.text:
Hitbox.Active -- boolean
A readonly boolean that displays whether the Hitbox is currently active or not. Note: You should change this with Hitbox:Activate() and Hitbox:Deactivate() instead.

docs.title: Hitbox.Radius
docs.text:
Hitbox.Radius -- number
The radius of the Hitbox. Used if Hitbox.Shape is Sphere. Note: CopyCFrame overrides this property.

docs.title: Hitbox.Size
docs.text:
Hitbox.Size -- Vector3
The size of the Hitbox. Used if Hitbox.Shape is Box. Note: CopyCFrame overrides this property.

docs.title: Hitbox.Trajectory
docs.text:
Hitbox.Trajectory -- Trajectory
The child Trajectory class of the Hitbox. Used for path construction.

docs.title: Hitbox.Hit
docs.text:
Hitbox.Hit -- ScriptSignal
Hitbox.Hit:Connect(function(Humanoid, HitPart, HitboxDataBundle)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal which is fired whenever the Hitbox hits a Humanoid that is not on Debounce and is not dead while the Hitbox is active.

docs.title: Hitbox.PartEntered
docs.text:
Hitbox.PartEntered -- ScriptSignal
Hitbox.PartEntered:Connect(function(BasePart)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal which is fired when any part enters the Hitbox while the Hitbox is active.

docs.title: Hitbox.PartLeft
docs.text:
Hitbox.PartLeft
Hitbox.PartLeft:Connect(function(BasePart)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal which is fired when any part leaves the Hitbox while the Hitbox is active.

docs.title: Hitbox:Activate()
docs.text:
Hitbox:Activate()
Activates the Hitbox. Note: When a new Hitbox is created, it is deactivated by default. You need to activate it after configuration.

docs.title: Hitbox:Deactivate()
docs.text:
Hitbox:Deactivate()
Deactivates the Hitbox, pausing all operations.

docs.title: Hitbox:AddIgnore(object: Instance)
docs.text:
local success = Hitbox:AddIgnore(game.Players.Player1.Character) -> boolean
Add object to FilterDescendentsInstances table of OverlapParams. Returns boolean Success.

docs.title: Hitbox:RemoveIgnore(object: Instance)
docs.text:
local numOfItemsRemoved = Hitbox:RemoveIgnore(game.Players.Player1.Character) -> number
Remove object from FilterDescendentsInstances table of OverlapParams. Returns number NumberOfItemsRemoved. **Note: The returned number is 0 on an unsuccessful remove, 1 or more on a successful remove.

docs.title: Hitbox:GetVelocity()
docs.text:
local velocity = Hitbox:GetVelocity() -> number
Returns the Velocity of the Hitbox's constructed path.

docs.title: Hitbox:SetVelocity()
docs.text:
Hitbox:SetVelocity(velocity: number)
Sets the Velocity of the Hitbox's constructed path to velocity.

docs.title: Hitbox:ChangeAttachment(attachment: Attachment?)
docs.text:
Hitbox:ChangeAttachment(attachment)
Changes the Hitbox's Attachment to attachment. If attachment is nil, remove Attachment from Hitbox.

docs.title: Hitbox:IsHitboxBackstab(Part: BasePart, DataBundle: HitboxDataBundle, Margin: number?)
docs.text:
local isBackstab = Hitbox:IsHitboxBackstab(HitPart, HitboxDataBundle, 0.2) -> boolean
Determine if the data described by HitboxDataBundle is a backstab on HitPart. Returns boolean. Margin is an optional number ranging from 0 to 0.5, which determines how lenient the backstab detection is. 0.5 would allow for side-stabs to count as backstabs while 0.1 would require basically perfect alignment. Defaults to 0.32. Note: The detection position originates from the Hitbox's recorded center position.

docs.title: Hitbox:IsBackstab(Part: BasePart, Character: Model, Margin: number?)
docs.text:
local isBackstab = Hitbox:IsBackstab(Part, Character, 0.4) -> boolean
Determine if Character backstabs Part. Returns boolean. Margin is an optional number ranging from 0 to 0.5, which determines how lenient the backstab detection is. 0.5 would allow for side-stabs to count as backstabs while 0.1 would require basically perfect alignment. Defaults to 0.32. Note: The detection position originates from the provided character's root. Recommended to use this over Hitbox:IsHitboxBackstab() if used in tools of a character.

docs.title: Hitbox:GetCurrentSerial()
docs.text:
local highestSerial = Hitbox:GetCurrentSerial() -> number
Get the currently highest serial. Returns number.

docs.title: Hitbox:GetConstructionMode()
docs.text:
local mode = Hitbox:GetConstructionMode() -> string
Returns the Hitbox's Trajectory's ConstructionMode.

docs.title: Hitbox:GetCurrentMode()
docs.text:
local mode = Hitbox:GetCurrentMode() -> string
Get the current behavior of the Hitbox. See Hitbox.ModeEnum.

docs.title: Hitbox:Visualize()
docs.text:
local part = Hitbox:Visualize() -> BasePart or nil
Visualizes the Hitbox and returns the visualization part if the Hitbox wasn't already visualizing. WARNING: The visualization only updates once every 5 frames and is UNOPTIMIZED. This should only be used for testing purposes.

docs.title: Hitbox:Unvisualize(doNotWarn: boolean?)
docs.text:
Hitbox:Unvisualize()
Unvisualizes the Hitbox. Throws a warn if doNotWarn isn't true and the Hitbox wasn't visualizing.

docs.title: Hitbox:Destroy()
docs.text:
Hitbox:Destroy()
Immediately clean and garbage collect Hitbox and all its children. Hitbox should be dereferenced after this operation.

docs.title: Private
docs.text: Note: Private variables, methods and functions should not be used unless you know what you're doing.

docs.title: Hitbox._Attachment
docs.text:
Hitbox._Attachment -- Attachment or nil
Internal store for the Hitbox's Attachment, if one exists. Note: You should use Hitbox:ChangeAttachment(attachment) instead.

docs.title: Hitbox._CurrentFrame
docs.text:
Hitbox._CurrentFrame -- number
The current frame of the Hitbox in the Hitbox's frame cycle. Note: Not strictly readonly, but it's a good idea to keep this readonly.

docs.title: Hitbox._CanWarn
docs.text:
Hitbox._CanWarn -- boolean
An internal variable that acts as throttle to prevent console spam.

docs.title: Hitbox._Visual
docs.text:
Hitbox._Visual -- BasePart
The part used for the Hitbox's visualization. WARNING: STRICTLY readonly. Use Hitbox:Visualize() and Hitbox:Unvisualize() instead.

docs.title: Hitbox._Destroying
docs.text:
Hitbox._Destroying -- boolean
Whether the Hitbox is being garbage collected currently or not. WARNINNG: Readonly. The Hitbox should be dereferenced if this value is true.

The main enum is intended to be completely private. You are not meant to access it.

docs.title: ScriptConnection
docs.text: A class returned by ScriptSignal:Connect() and ScriptSignal:Once().

docs.title: ScriptConnection.StateEnum
docs.text:
ScriptConnection.StateEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.StateEnum. Includes StateEnum.Paused, StateEnum.Active and StateEnum.Dead.

docs.title: ScriptConnection:GetIdentifier()
docs.text:
local identifier = ScriptConnection:GetIdentifier() -> string
Return the ScriptConnection's unique identifier as a string.

docs.title: ScriptConnection:Disconnect()
docs.text:
ScriptConnection:Disconnect()
Disconnect the ScriptConnection, clean the entire object to be garbage collected except for ScriptConnection._State. Set ScriptConnection._State to "Dead".

docs.title: Private
docs.text: Note: Private variables, methods and functions should not be used unless you know what you're doing.

docs.title: ScriptConnection._Connected
docs.text:
ScriptConnection._Connected -- boolean
Whether the ScriptConnection is connected or not.

docs.title: ScriptConnection._Once
docs.text:
ScriptConnect._Once -- boolean
If true, automatically disconnects the ScriptConnection immediately when being fired the next time.

docs.title: ScriptConnection._Identifier
docs.text:
ScriptConnection._Identifier -- string
The assigned unique identifier of the ScriptConnection.

docs.title: ScriptConnection._State
docs.text:
ScriptConnection._State -- string
The current state of the ScriptConnection. Can be Active, Paused or Dead. If the state is Dead, the ScriptConnection should not be referenced anymore.

docs.title: ScriptConnection._Signal
docs.text:
ScriptConnection._Signal -- ScriptSignal
A pointer to the parent ScriptSignal.

docs.title: ScriptConnection._Function
docs.text:
ScriptConnection._Function -- function
The function that will be fired when the ScriptConnection is fired.

docs.title: ScriptConnection._Fire(...)
docs.text:
ScriptConnection._Fire(...)
An internal function to fire the ScriptConnection. Passes the arguments to the fired function.

The main enum is intended to be completely private. You are not meant to access it.

docs.title: ScriptSignal
docs.text: A member class of Hitbox and Zone. Also returned by Module.newSignal().

docs.title: ScriptSignal.StateEnum
docs.text:
ScriptSignal.StateEnum -- string
An immutable copy of enum.StateEnum. Includes StateEnum.Paused, StateEnum.Active and StateEnum.Dead.

docs.title: ScriptSignal:Connect(func: function, connectImmediately: boolean?)
docs.text:
local Connection = ScriptSignal:Connect(function()
    ...
end, false) -> ScriptConnection
Creates a new ScriptConnection. If connectImmediately is true or nil, the ScriptConnection is then immediately connected to the ScriptSignal.

docs.title: ScriptSignal:Once(func: function)
docs.text:
local Connection = ScriptSignal:Once(function()
    ...
end)
Creates a new connected ScriptConnection. The ScriptConnection will clean and garbage collect itself when it is fired for the first time.

docs.title: ScriptSignal:DisconnectAll()
docs.text:
ScriptSignal:DisconnectAll()
Disconnect and garbage collect all of ScriptSignal's ScriptConnections.

docs.title: ScriptSignal:DisconnectOne(identifier: string)
docs.text:
ScriptSignal:DisconnectOne("GH4X-K93A-3914-FD3P-MN0O")
Disconnect any ScriptConnection connected to ScriptSignal with identifier as its identifier.

docs.title: ScriptSignal:Fire(...)
docs.text:
ScriptSignal:Fire(...)
Fire all of ScriptSignal's ScriptConnections and passes ... as arguments.

docs.title: ScriptSignal:FireOne(identifier: string, args: {...})
docs.text:
ScriptSignal:FireOne("GH4X-K93A-3914-FD3P-MN0O", {...})
Fire any ScriptConnection connected to ScriptSignal with identifier as its identifier. Passes an unpacked version of args as arguments.

docs.title: ScriptSignal:GetState()
docs.text:
local state = ScriptSignal:GetState() -> string
Get the current state of the ScriptSignal. WARNING: Calling this method while the ScriptSignal is Dead will throw an error.

docs.title: ScriptSignal:Destroy()
docs.text:
ScriptSignal:Destroy()
Immediately clean and garbage collect ScriptSignal and all its children. ScriptSignal should be dereferenced after this operation.

docs.title: Private
docs.text: Note: Private variables, methods and functions should not be used unless you know what you're doing.

docs.title: ScriptSignal._State
docs.text:
ScriptSignal._State -- string
The current state of the ScriptSignal. Can be Active, Paused or Dead. If the state is Dead, the ScriptSignal should not be referenced anymore.

docs.title: ScriptSignal._ActiveRunner
docs.text:
ScriptSignal._ActiveRunner -- ConnectionRunner
The active ConnectionRunner middleware of the ScriptSignal. WARNING: ConnectionRunner is intended to be completely private. You should not perform any operation on it. The main enum is intended to be completely private. You are not meant to access it.

docs.title: Trajectory
docs.text: Child class of Hitbox. Used for constructing paths that the Hitbox will traverse automatically.

docs.title: Trajectory.ConstructionMode
docs.text:
Trajectory.ConstructionMode -- string
The current ConstructionMode of the Trajectory. Can be None, Linear or Bezier

docs.title: Trajectory.Velocity
docs.text:
Trajectory.Velocity -- number
The speed in studs per second in which the Hitbox will traverse the constructed path.

docs.title: Trajectory:Construct(ConstructionMode: string, Fields: {string: any})
docs.text:
Trajectory:Construct("Linear", {
    DirectionalVector = Vector3.new(0.55, -0.02, 0.4),
    Velocity = 25
})
Trajectory:Construct("Bezier", {
    BezierPoints = {
        Start = Vector3.new(),
        Control1 = Vector3.new(),
        Control2 = Vector3.new() or nil,
        End = Vector3.new()
    },
    Velocity = 25
})
Trajectory:Construct("None")
Construct a path using ConstructionMode and Fields as seen above. If BezierPoints.Control2 is nil, the path will become a quadratic bezier curve. Otherwise, the path will become a cubic bezier curve. DirectionalVector MUST be a normalized. If Velocity is nil, it will use the previous Velocity. If ConstructionMode is None, deconstructs the path instead.

docs.title: Trajectory:Deconstruct()
docs.text:
Trajectory:Deconstruct()
Deconstruct any constructed path and sets Trajectory.ConstructionMode to None.

docs.title: Private
docs.text: Note: Private variables, methods and functions should not be used unless you know what you're doing.

docs.title: Trajectory._DirectionalVector
docs.text:
Trajectory._DirectionVector -- Vector3 or nil
The stored DirectionalVector from Trajectory:Construct().

docs.title: Trajectory._Length
docs.text:
Trajectory._Length -- number
Stores the approximate length of the path only if the ConstructionMode is Bezier.

docs.title: Trajectory._Completion
docs.text:
Trajectory._Completion -- number
A normalized number which tracks how close the Hitbox is to the end of the path only if the ConstructionMode is Bezier.

docs.title: Trajectory._Points
docs.text:
Trajectory._Points --[[ {
                          Start = Vector3.new(),
                          Control1 = Vector3.new(),
                          Control2 = Vector3.new() or nil,
                          End = Vector3.new()
                        } --]]
The stored BezierPoints from Trajectory:Construct().

docs.title: Trajectory:_GetBezierMode()
docs.text:
local mode = Trajectory:_GetBezierMode() -> string
Returns either Quad or Cubic based on the bezier formula used.

docs.title: Zone
docs.text: Parent class of ZoneComponent, ScriptSignal and Metafunctions. Returned by Module.newZone(Fields).

docs.title: Zone.CharacterResolutionEnum
docs.text:
Zone.CharacterResolutionEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.CharacterResolution. Includes CharacterResolutionEnum.FullBody, CharacterResolutionEnum.Root, CharacterResolutionEnum.Head and CharacterResolutionEnum.OnePart.

docs.title: Zone.QueryTypeEnum
docs.text:
Zone.QueryTypeEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.QueryType. Includes QueryTypeEnum.Full and QueryTypeEnum.Bounds.

docs.title: Zone.StateEnum
docs.text:
Zone.StateEnum -- {string: string}
An immutable copy of enum.StateEnum. Includes StateEnum.Paused, StateEnum.Active and StateEnum.Dead.

docs.title: Zone.PartEntered
docs.text:
Zone.PartEntered -- ScriptSignal
local connection = Zone.PartEntered:Connect(function(oart)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal that fires when a part enters the Zone.

docs.title: Zone.PartLeft
docs.text:
Zone.PartLeft -- ScriptSignal
local connection = Zone.PartLeft:Connect(function(part)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal that fires when a part leaves the Zone.

docs.title: Zone.CharacterEntered
docs.text:
Zone.CharacterEntered -- ScriptSignal
local connection = Zone.CharacterEntered:Connect(function(character)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal that fires when a character (including players) enter the Zone.

docs.title: Zone.CharacterLeft
docs.text:
Zone.CharacterLeft -- ScriptSignal
local connection = Zone.CharacterLeft:Connect(function(character)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal that fires when a character (including players) leaves the Zone.

docs.title: Zone.PlayerEntered
docs.text:
Zone.PlayerEntered -- ScriptSignal
local connection = Zone.PlayerEntered:Connect(function(character)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal that fires when a player enters the Zone.

docs.title: Zone.PlayerLeft
docs.text:
Zone.PlayerLeft -- ScriptSignal
local connection = Zone.PlayerLeft:Connect(function(character)
    ...
end)
A ScriptSignal that fires when a player leaves the Zone.

docs.title: Zone.Serial
docs.text:
Zone.Serial -- number
A readonly number which stores the serial of the Zone. Note: Both Hitbox and Zone share the same serial incrementation.

docs.title: Zone.CharacterResolution
docs.text:
Zone.CharacterResolution -- string
What part(s) of a character must be present within the Zone in order for it to be fired in CharacterEntered, CharacterLeft, PlayerEntered and PlayerLeft. Can be FullBody, Root, Head or OnePart.

docs.title: Zone.QueryType
docs.text:
Zone.QueryType -- string
Determines the type of spatial query. Can be Full or Bounds.

docs.title: Zone.Rate
docs.text:
Zone.Rate -- number
How many times a second the Zone queries. Default 10.

docs.title: Zone.OverlapParams
docs.text:
Zone.OverlapParams -- OverlapParams
The OverlapParams used in spatial query.

docs.title: Zone.Active
docs.text:
Zone.Active -- boolean
A readonly boolean which indicates whether the Zone is activated or not. Note: You should use Zone:Activate() and Zone:Deactivate() instead.

docs.title: Zone:AddMemberBulk(partList: {BasePart})
docs.text:
Zone:AddMemberBulk({part1, part2})
Add a list of BaseParts into the Zone, automatically intiating their own ZoneComponents and Metafunctions.

docs.title: Zone:AddMember(part: BasePart, Metafunctions: {string: function})
docs.text:
Zone:AddMember(part, metafunctions)
Add a BasePart into the Zone, automatically initiating a ZoneComponent for it. Metafunctions must be provided. Note: Use Zone:TranslateToMetafunction(part) to generate a basic Metafunction that you can use.

docs.title: Zone:TranslateToMetafunction(part: BasePart)
docs.text:
local metafunctions = Zone:TranslateToMetafunction(part) -> {string: function}
Generate a basic metafunction from part.

docs.title: Zone:RemoveMember(part: BasePart)
docs.text:
Zone:RemoveMember(part)
Remove part from the Zone if it exists, also removing all its associated ZoneComponents and Metafunctions.

docs.title: Zone:AddComponent(component: ZoneComponent)
docs.text:
local serial = Zone:AddComponent(component) -> number or nil
Add a ZoneComponent to the Zone directly, without the need for a BasePart. Returns the serial of the ZoneComponent if added successfully. Note: Methods dealing with ZoneComponents directly are for advanced use-cases. Do not use unless you know what you're doing.

docs.title: Zone:RemoveComponent(serial: number)
docs.text:
Zone:RemoveComponent(index: BasePart or number)
Remove ZoneComponent with index from the Zone. ZoneComponent generated from Zone:AddMember() and Zone:AddMemberBulk() have a BasePart index, while ZoneComponent generated from Zone:AddComponent() have a number index (same as its serial).

docs.title: Zone:Update()
docs.text:
Zone:Update()
Manually trigger an update of the Zone. Note: You should call this if you change the Zone's properties or its ZoneComponents without using a built-in method.

docs.title: Zone:Activate()
docs.text:
Zone:Activate()
Activates the Zone, resuming all spatial queries. Note: Zones are deactivated by default when created. You must call this method for the Zone to work.

docs.title: Zone:Deactivate()
docs.text:
Zone:Deactivate()
Deactivates the Zone, pausing all spatial queries.

docs.title: Zone:IsPartInside(part: BasePart)
docs.text:
local isInside = Zone:IsPartInside(part) -> boolean
Returns whether part is inside the Zone or not based on the Zone's query rules.

docs.title: Zone:IsCharacterInside(character: Model)
docs.text:
local isInside = Zone:IsCharacterInside(character) -> boolean
Returns whether character is inside the Zone or not based on the Zone's query rules.

docs.title: Zone:IsPlayerInside(character: Model)
docs.text:
local isInside = Zone:IsPlayerInside(character) -> boolean
Returns whether character is inside the Zone or not based on the Zone's query rules.

docs.title: Zone:GetPartsInside()
docs.text:
local partList = Zone:GetPartsInside -> {BasePart}
Returns a list of all parts inside the Zone based on the Zone's query rules. Note: May or may not include member parts of the Zone.

docs.title: Zone:GetCharactersInside()
docs.text:
local characterList = Zone:GetCharactersInside() -> {Model}
Returns a list of characters inside the Zone based on the Zone's query rules.

docs.title: Zone:GetPlayersInside()
docs.text:
local playerCharacterList = Zone:GetPlayersInside() -> {Model}
Returns a list of player characters inside the Zone based on the Zone's query rules.

docs.title: Zone:Destroy()
docs.text:
Zone:Destroy()
Immediately clean and garbage collect the Zone, along with all its child ZoneComponents, ScriptSignals and Metafunctions. Note: The Zone should be dereferenced after calling this method.

docs.title: Zone._CurrentFrame
docs.text:
Zone._CurrentFrame -- number
An internal counter of the Zone's frame cycle. Note: This should be kept readonly.

docs.title: Zone._CanWarn
docs.text:
Zone._CanWarn -- boolean
An internal variable that acts as throttle to prevent console spam.

docs.title: Zone._Visual
docs.text:
Zone._Visual -- BasePart or nil
WARNING: This is STRICTLY readonly and internal. This should not be used under any circumstance.

docs.title: Zone._MemberParts
docs.text:
Zone._MemberParts -- {BasePart}
An internal store for the Zone's member parts.

docs.title: Zone._MemberComponents
docs.text:
Zone._MemberComponents -- {BasePart or number: ZoneComponent}
An internal store for the Zone's ZoneComponents.

docs.title: Zone._PartsInside
docs.text:
Zone._PartsInside -- {BasePart}
An internal cache.

docs.title: Zone._CharactersInside
docs.text:
Zone._CharactersInside -- {Model}
An internal cache.

docs.title: Zone._PlayersInside
docs.text:
Zone._PlayersInside -- {Model}
An internal cahce.

docs.title: Zone._Destroying
docs.text:
Zone._Destroying -- boolean
An internal indicator indicating whether the Zone is being garbage collected or not. Note: The Zone should be dereferenced if this value is true.

docs.title: Zone._FirstQuery
docs.text:
Zone._FirstQuery -- boolean
An internal value. If true, the next query will not trigger PartEntered, PartLeft, CharacterEntered, CharacterLeft, PlayerEntered and PlayerLeft, then the value becomes false.

The main enum and Metafunctions are intended to be completely private. You are not meant to access them.

docs.title: ZoneComponent
docs.text: Child class of Zone. Represents a part in a Zone.

docs.title: ZoneComponent.Shape
docs.text:
ZoneComponent.Shape -- Enum.PartType
The shape of the ZoneComponent.

docs.title: ZoneComponent.CFrame
docs.text:
ZoneComponent.CFrame -- CFrame
The CFrame of the ZoneComponent.

docs.title: ZoneComponent.Size
docs.text:
ZoneComponent.Size -- Vector3
The Size of the ZoneComponent.

docs.title: ZoneComponent:Query(QueryType: string, Params: OverlapParams)
docs.text:
local PartList = ZoneComponent:Query("Full", OverlapParams) -> {BasePart}
QueryType can be Full or Bounds. Returns an array of BasePart inside the ZoneComponent.

docs.title: ZoneComponent:GetCharacters(CharacterResolution: string, QueryType: string, Params: OverlapParams)
docs.text:
local CharacterList = ZoneComponent:GetCharacters("OnePart", "Bounds", OverlapParams) -> {Model}
CharacterResolution can be FullBody or Root or Head or OnePart. QueryType can be Full or Bounds. Returns an array of Characters inside the ZoneComponent.

docs.title: ZoneComponent:GetPlayers(CharacterResolution: string, QueryType: string, Params: OverlapParams)
docs.text:
local PlayerCharacterList = ZoneComponent:GetPlayers("OnePart", "Bounds", OverlapParams) -> {Model}
CharacterResolution can be FullBody or Root or Head or OnePart. QueryType can be Full or Bounds. Returns an array of PlayerCharacters inside the ZoneComponent.

docs.title: ZoneComponent:Destroy()
docs.text:
ZoneComponent:Destroy()
Clean and garbage collect the ZoneComponent immediately. WARNING: Do NOT call when the ZoneComponent is a child of a Zone.

docs.title: ZoneComponent._Part
docs.text:
ZoneComponent._Part -- BasePart or nil
An internal pointer. WARNING: STRICTLY readonly.

docs.title: ZoneComponent._State
docs.text:
ZoneComponent._State -- string
The current state of the ZoneComponent. Can be Active, Paused or Dead. If the state is Dead, the ZoneComponent should not be referenced anymore.

docs.title: ZoneComponent:_NewPart()
docs.text:
ZoneComponent:_NewPart()
An internal method. WARNING: Do NOT call under any circumstance.

docs.title: Hitbox
docs.text:
Simple melee weapon (server): 

local ReplicatedStorage = game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage")
local HitboxRemaster = require(modules:WaitForChild("HitboxRemaster"))
local Tool = script.Parent
local Handle = Tool:WaitForChild("Handle")
local Debounce = true

Tool.Activated:Connect(function()
    if Debounce == false then
        return
    end
    Debounce = false
    task.delay(1, function()
        Debounce = true
    end)
    local Hitbox = HitboxRemaster.newHitbox({
        ["Pierce"] = 3
    })
    Hitbox:AddIgnore(Tool.Parent)
    Hitbox.CopyCFrame = Handle
    Hitbox.Hit:Connect(function(Humanoid, HitPart, DataBundle)
        if Hitbox:IsHitboxBackstab(HitPart, DataBundle) == true then -- You can use Hitbox:IsBackstab(HitPart, Character) instead!
            Humanoid:TakeDamage(20)
        else
            Humanoid:TakeDamage(10)
        end
    end)
    Hitbox:Activate()
end)
Note: Hitbox can also be used on client.

docs.title: Zone
docs.text:
Client-sided Zone example: 

local ReplicatedStorage = game:GetService("ReplicatedStorage")
local HitboxRemaster = require(modules:WaitForChild("HitboxRemaster"))
local QueryFunction = ReplicatedStorage:WaitForChild("QueryFunction")
local partList = workspace.ZoneTest:GetChildren() -- All members of partList MUST be BasePart!

local Zone = HitboxRemaster.newZone({
    ["CharacterResolution"] = "OnePart",
    ["QueryType"] = "Full"
})
Zone:AddMemberBulk(partList)

Zone.PartEntered:Connect(function(part)
    print("Part entered! " .. part.Name)
end)

Zone.PartLeft:Connect(function(part)
    print("Part left! " .. part.Name)
end)

Zone.CharacterEntered:Connect(function(char)
    print("Character entered! " .. char.Name)
end)

Zone.CharacterLeft:Connect(function(char)
    print("Character left! " .. char.Name)
end)

Zone.PlayerEntered:Connect(function(char)
    print("Player entered! " .. char.Name)
end)

Zone.PlayerLeft:Connect(function(char)
    print("Player left! " .. char.Name)
end)

Zone:Activate()

QueryEvent.OnClientInvoke = function()
    return Zone:GetCharactersInside()
end
Note: Zone can be used the same way in both server and client.
